text.p: Multimedia company Creative Technology said on Saturday it was mindful of competition but dismissed software launched by Venture Manufacturing last week as serious threat.
"We are always a very paranoid company," when it comes to competition, Sim Wong Hoo, Creative's chairman, told reporters at a briefing.
But the new NovaStation software from Venture, Singapore's leading contract manufacturer, was not among its main threats, he said.
Creative's share price plunged last week on news of Venture's NovaStation, multimedia software that upgrades all 16-bit compatible soundcards and allows 128 instruments to be played simultaneusly.
Venture said it was selling NovaStation to the original equipment market (OEM).
Creative's strength in its audio products is in the retail market, analysts said.
Sim said the retail distribution channel especially in the U.S. was "treacherous" and would not be easy for any newcomer to penetrate.
He added Creative had the muscle to flood its products into the retail market if it wanted to.
Creative viewed companies like OPTi, Diamond Multimedia, Yamaha Corp, and Intel as bigger threats, Sim said.
